channel.title: Cannot file server.class -.-
channel.description:
Alright here is my error when I run the server
[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: Server. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Alright and I have the Server.class file in the server folder??? This is battlescape.

item.title: Cannot file server.class -.-
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

You need to put your run.bat back into your client folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot file server.class -.-
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Did you compile? If so, make sure the Server class is named properly.

Server should start with a capital. Naming conventions state that class names start with uppercase. And local variables and objects start with a lowercase.

Also make sure the batch/shell file that calls the VM, is pointed to the directory that has the class files.
For example, the class files are located inside a build dir. And the batch file is located in the main dir.

@echo off
cd build
java Server

If your server is packaged you have to include the package name aswell.
For example, the Server class is in a package called org.

@echo off
java -cp . org.Server

Finally, the class that you call from the VM must have a main method.
This one:

public static void main(String commandLineArguments[])

When you run a program in JavaVM, it will look for the main method. If the program doesnâ€™t have one in the Class file that is called, it will terminate and print out that error.

Read full topic

Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .

Alright and I have the Server.class file in the server folder???
